sentences.sentence: The Sick Lion
A lion was too old and weak to be able to hunt( 捕猎 ), so he decided to get his food by tricking( 欺骗 ) the other animals.
He returned to the cave( 洞穴 ) where he lived, lying down there, and pretended( 假装 ) to be sick, making sure that his sickness should be publicly known.
The beasts( 野兽 ) all said they were sorry, and came one by one to his cave( 洞穴 ), where the lion ate them.
After many of the beasts( 野兽 ) had been eaten like this, the fox( 狐狸 ) came and introduced himself to the lion,
standing outside the cave( 洞穴 ) some distance away, and asked him how he was.
“I am afraid I am not very well,” replied the lion,
“but why do you stand outside? Please come in and talk with me.”
“No, thank you,” said the fox( 狐狸 ).
“I notice that there are many prints of feet entering your cave( 洞穴 ), but I see no sign of any returning.”
MORAL: A wise person learns from the misfortunes( 不幸 ) of others.
The Sick Stag( 雄鹿 )
A sick stag( 雄鹿 ) lay down in a quiet corner of his field.
Many of his friends came to ask about his health, but each one took some of the food which had been left for him to eat.
Finally he died, not from his sickness, but from a lack of food.
MORAL: Sometimes those who claim to be helping you are actually( 事实上 ) using you.
The Soldier( 士兵 ) and His Horse
While the war was going on, a soldier( 士兵 ) gave his horse plenty of( 充足的 ) good food and looked after him well,
because he wished his horse to be strong enough for the hard life of the battle,
and fast enough to carry his master( 主人 ) out of danger.
But when the war was over, he gave him all sorts of difficult, dirty, and unpleasant work,
and gave him nothing to eat except old, dry grass from his farm.
The time came when war began again, and the soldier( 士兵 ) prepared his horse once more for war.
He put on his heavy metal( 金属 ) armor( 盔甲 ), got on the horse, and tried to ride off to the war.
But the poor, hungry animal could not carry the weight, and said to his rider,
“You will have to go into battle on foot this time.
The hard work and bad food you have given me have turned me from a horse into a donkey( 驴 );
and you cannot in a moment turn me back again into a horse.”
MORAL: If you neglect( 忽视 ) someone now, don’t depend on( 依赖 ) them helping you later.
The Stag( 雄鹿 ) at the Pool
A stag( 雄鹿 ) saw himself in the water, and greatly admired( 欣赏 ) the size of his horns( 角 ),
but felt angry with himself for having such weak feet.
While he was thinking about this, a lion appeared at the pool.
The stag( 雄鹿 ) started to run, and kept himself at a safe distance from the lion.
However, when he entered the forest, his horns( 角 ) became stuck in a tree.
The lion quickly came up and caught him.
When it was too late, he said to himself,
“How wrong I am! I hated these feet which would have saved me, but loved these horns( 角 ) which have led to my death.”
MORAL: What is most truly valuable is often undervalued( 被轻视 ).

question.cn: 在The Sick Lion故事中，狐狸为什么拒绝进入狮子的洞里？
question.en: In the story the Sick Lion, why did the fox refuse to enter the lion's cave?

options.cn: 他没有发现出来的脚印。
options.en: He noticed that there was no footprints coming out of it.
He was too large to go in.
He wanted the lion to come out.

analysis: 文中提到：“No, thank you,”said the fox, “I notice that there are many prints of feet entering your cave, but I see no sign of any returning.”狐狸没有看见出来的脚印，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Sick Stag中，什么造成了雄鹿的死亡？
question.en: In the story The Sick Stag, what caused the death of the stag?

analysis: 文中提到：“Finally he died, not from his sickness, but from a lack of food. ”因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Soldier and His Horse中，刚开始士兵为什么会很用心的照顾马匹？
question.en: In the story the Soldier and His Horse, why did the soldier take very good care of his horse at first?

options.en: He loved his horse very much.

options.cn: 他想让他的马足够强壮，从而在战斗中帮助自己。
options.en: He wished his horse to be strong enough to help him in the battle.

analysis: 文中提到：“ Because he wished his horse to be strong enough for the hard life of the battle, and fast enough to carry his master out of danger.”士兵很好地照顾马的原因是想让马足够强壮，在激烈的战斗中帮助到自己，因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Soldier and His Horse中，当战争再次爆发的时候，马能载动他的主人吗？
question.en: In the story the Solider and His Horse, was the horse able to carry his master when the war started again?

analysis: 文中提到：“But the poor, hungry animal could not carry the weight, and …  the hard work and bad food you have given me have turned me from a horse into a donkey; and you cannot in a moment turn me back again into a horse.”可知，现在马已经很虚弱了，他没有能力帮助主人，因此选B.

question.cn: 在故事The Stag at the Pool中，雄鹿为什么会被狮子抓住？
question.en: In the story the Stag at the Pool, why was the stag caught by the lion?

options.en: His horn was stuck in a tree.

analysis: 文中提到：“However, when he entered the forest, his horns became stuck in a tree. ”当雄鹿跑到森林中的时候，他的角卡在了树上，因此选B。
